item.description:
The game is played in two courses. In the first course (Duck), both of you, after playing to a trick, draw the top card from the stock to restore your hand to thirteen cards. In the second course (Soup), which begins when the stock runs out, you play your hands out to a finish.
 
You'll find it more profitable to win a middling number of tricks in both courses than many in one course and few in the other because you each calculate your final score for the whole deal by multiplying together your two scores for the individual courses. For example, if in the Duck course you took 6 tricks for 7 points, and in the Soup course you took 5 tricks for 8 points, your final score will be 7 x 8 = 56.

name.value: Gliders from the Sky: The Fall of Eben Emael

item.description:
This is a game on the fall of the Belgian fortress of Eben Emael, May 10-11 1940, by a daring and unheard of, at time, glider attack made by less than 100 German paratroopers. It's a fast and furious solitaire game (you take the German side and try to make the best of it), that should be playable in less than an hour, once you master the game.

To try to make the victory harder to get, several variants and optional rules are provided, based on the historical situation and on several what if situations that could have happened on those fateful hours that cleared the way for the German initial smashing victory in the West.

Contains:
8 Page Rules
A4 Map (7.5"x10.8")
187 Counters.

This Print-n-Play download is available at wargamedownloads.com and as a laser-printed DTP from Boulder Games.
http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=610

Casino The Board Game is a roll and move game in which players move around a board and play different games of chance based on what space they land.

The game includes the following casino games:
Blackjack
Craps
Roulette
Seven Stud
Slots
Baccarat
Hold'em
Omaha
Video Poker
Pai Gow Poker
Red Dog
Cash Wheel

In Retsami (conspicuously "I master" backward), each player attempts to get a single piece to the center, Home, space. The players' pieces start interspersed along the furthest end of a spiral path on a 9×9 board. Pieces move along the spiral path; however, they can also capture orthogonally or diagonally.

item.description: A memory game for children Ages 4 and up. Players turn over wooden pieces with either images or golden stars on it. While collecting pairs, turning over stars let the moon rise higher on the board. The player owning the most pairs when the moon reaches the top of the sky wins the game.

The game of futuristic international automated warfare.

In the future, war will be fought without humans on the battlefield. CasualTees is a tabletop miniatures wargame that recreates the experience of future wars. Each pre-painted miniature represents one automated army unit that a future General might have at his or her disposal.

Dexterity game in which players take turns trying to capture small balls under a cup, each ball has a string attached to it, given the other players a chance to yank each ball clear before it's captured.
Similar to many horse racing games, in this case the players control greyhound dogs going around an oval track.
Roll & move game in which players score points for performing aerobatics in their gliders.

A very simple shuffleboard game. Players use egg-shaped pieces. The board has two sides, a simple version in which there are 19 scoring holes of varying values. The flip-side has a miniature golf feel, in that a clown must be dodged in order to get to the scoring holes.
Classic Spears roll and move game with an inward spiraling board. The pawns are metal firemen.

Rocket Bowling is a vintage tin action toy.

For one or more players.
Play time is approx. 15-20 Mins. or more depending on how many players you have.

Set includes: one tin bowling lane (29.75"L X 6.25"W), 10 real wooden pins, two black marbles, and, one tin bowler figure.

You start the game by setting up the bowler on the end of the lane. His arm is pulled back behind a lever and the ball (marble) is placed on a stand in front of the bowlers right arm. Place the ten wooden pins on the ten markers. Now you aim and pull the trigger to release the bowlers arm and hopefully you've got yourself a strike! You score the game exactly the same as you would a real game.

A children's version of roulette in which the turning blades of a windmill push each players token into a numbered hole. The winner is the one whose token gets to the highest number. Unlike most roulette games, the windmill is set in the middle of a rectangle.
Children's game in which small cue sticks are used to hit balls slightly bigger than a normal marble. The idea is to hit the balls so they rest directly underneath the arches of a bridge.

A simple roll and move game in which mice grab the cheese race to finish before being caught by the cats.

Contents:
1 Built-in-the-Box Game Board
8 Cat Catchers
1 6-Sided Die
4 Red Mice
4 Blue Mice
4 Green Mice
4 Yellow Mice

A well-equipped game with a seldom used scenario: Kart Racing !

Before starting the game the players agree how many times they want to round the racecourse.

Each one starts with a different kart and tries to outwit the opponent upon grading up his race gear, either by card play or by investing money. The money has to be earned during the race.

You can do this by reaching different spaces on the racecourse or by playing one of the 50 action-cards at the right time, on top of throwing the right number on the die.

These cards allow weird actions, such as throwing a hay bale (come with the game- although in plastic...)in front of another cart or hauling it in with a lasso! For certain situations you can even earn a gold medal.

Winner is the player with the most points for the best kart, the most money, the most rounds in the lead, the best actions, for holding the gold medal etc.

There is also a variant to play as an elimination race, the last one staying upright is the winner !

1st Newbury is the third game in TCS series of games on the English Civil War, the first to add artillery, facing and command radius rules to the previous set of rules. Easy to play, fast and furious see-saw battle, perfect for solitaire and competitive lunch hour game.

link.value: Battles of the English Civil Wars 1642 - 1651 Volume I
Battles of the English Civil Wars 1642 - 1651 Volume I

item.description:
This game seems to have some of the most uniquely formed tiles: They look like the outer shape of a water fountain after a pipe has burst.

There are 78 of these tiles, depicting flowers, leaves, bees, bugs and scissors.
The winner is the one who builds at first on the playing mat in front of him 4 flowers. Two of these have to be from the same kind.

With the scissors you can cut an unfinished flower from an opponent and use his tiles for yourself.
The bug allows to change a certain number of tiles (variable) and placed on top of one of your flowers prevents the opponent to cut it.

At the end of the game the flowers count different point value.

This is a stripped down variant of the OGALLALA game from the same author.

item.description:
This light filler from Rudi Hoffmann is somewhat different in several ways.
It uses the closed box as part of the game. As a rules sheet or booklet would hinder play the rules are printed on top of the box lid.

Game consists of 6 coloured player mats, each depicting the outer lines of a parrot. The parrot has to be puzzled of 6 different parts.

To claim these parts (also in 6 colours), you have to close the box and to rattle it back and forth, up and down. When you open it, you see a hole in an insert cardboard mask, also depicting a parrot. Below this mask is a two-sided ramp with a plateau in the middle, where you notice a circle.

If you find one or more parrot-puzzle-piece(s) touching the circle, you can take them to complete the parrot on your mat.
Pieces you already claimed before are put back in the box.

The completed parrot is worth different points, regarding how much different colours it contains (the more the better).

A quiz game where you are climbing a ladder to be first to the top, get 12 right & you've won (similar to 'Who wants to be a Millionaire') but your opponents will hamper you & the nearer you get to the top the further the fall !

Can you remember which Swiss company makes the milky bar, what colour is B&Q's logo or what SAS stands for ?

Contents

600 x Question cards with 3600 questions

1 x Ladder Scorecard

1 x Rules sheet

Preferences is a fast-moving, light hearted party game of likes & dislikes in which everybody has to guess everybody else's preferences in a wide range of topics & categories.

A game to play time & time again !

Contents

90 x Preference cards

30 x Bonus cards

6 x Sets of voting cards

6 x Pencils

1 x Sand timer

1 x Preferences pad

1 x Scorecard

1 x Rules sheet

Challenge your friends to a Gruesome Games play-off & you'll be an awesome ancient expert in no time.

Knuckle down to a game of chuckstones with the rotten Romans, try some awfully old blindfold games, get sneaky with the Egyptian snake game or go head-to-head with the groovy Greeks in their coin-flipping contest.

Ancient games & some still played in their countries of origin.

Play games & learn ancient history at the same time !

Contents

1 x Double-sided coin

5 x Knucklebones

6 x Blue counters

6 x Red counters

1 x Blindfold

1 Rules leaflet

Match the sequence of balls in your playing position to that shown in the centre ring ... Sounds easy !?

The Popball motor sends the balls hurtling around at a furious pace! You must react every time one lands in your area. Is it the right colour ? In the right place ? Better hurry before the timer runs out and changes the sequence.

Or your opponent beats you to it !

Contents

1 x Motorised Game board

1 x Set coloured balls

1 x Multi-lingual rules booklet

We lack Quiz as a mechanism and Science as a theme. This is a non-trivial quiz based game based upon the superb and highly entertaining Science and Aeronautic Museum in Munich, Germany. Answer technical questions based on the different areas of study in the Museum, such as Flight and Astronomy, Communications, Energy, and move through the zones on the board. Gain more points the more you progress to the centre in tactical moves.

item.description: In this game, you play as Rugrats characters trying to bust out of the play pen by riding the dog, Spike. You have to avoid obstacles like scattered toys and Angelica to escape successfully.

name.value: Door County: Season to Season, Shore to Shore – A Property Trading Game

item.description: Door County - Season to Season, Shore to Shore, A Property Trading Game is a Monopoly type game that uses Wisconsin's Door County as a setting. Play is exactly like Monopoly with the traditional locations substituted with Door County landmarks like Dairy View, County Store,Door County YMCA and Little Sweden. Playing pieces include a Lighthouse, Cookie the Cow, Train, Cherry Pie, Yacht and Anchor.

link.value: Late for the Sky Production Company

item.description: Nimble Numbers is a partnership Tic-tac-Toe variant that uses rotating disks. Additionally, besides just trying to get 3 in a row, you attempt to collect combinations of numbers to improve your scoring.

TZAAR is a game about making choices. Both players have 30 pieces, divided in three types: 6 Tzaars, 9 Tzarras and 15 Totts. The three types of pieces form a trinity: They cannot exist without each other. The aim is either to make the opponent run out of one of the three types of pieces or to put him in a position in which he cannot capture any more. The tricky question the players will have to ask themselves on each of their turns is: “Shall I make myself stronger or my opponent weaker?” Meaning: Will you capture an opponent’s piece and make him weaker, or will you jump on top of one of your own pieces and make yourself stronger? If you choose to jump on top of your own pieces too often, you will probably leave your opponent with too many pieces on the board. On the other hand, if you capture too often, you may end up with pieces that are not strong enough at the end of the game. What to do? Up to you to decide!

TZAAR replaced TAMSK as part of project GIPF, which was felt to not quite fit in with the others due to its use of sand timers.

item.description: In this game you can replay the show Quiz Taxi where a well known tv host drives around in a taxi (he's the driver) and everybody who calls this certain taxi suddenly (and without them knowing)is a participant in a tv quiz show. The questions get asked on the way to the participant's original destination. If they fail, the taxi stops and they have to get out, if they don't fail more than three times (they have 2 jokers - a phone call and asking people on the street) and they get to their destination, they can either get the money or play at high risk to lose everything, or win twice as much.

In the multiplayer card-driven, city-building strategy game Forged in Steel, players take on the role of a prominent family in a burgeoning Colorado county in 1900 as turbulent social and technological changes are about to reshape the way all Americans live. Each family seeks to control one of four sectors (mining, industry, city, or commercial) while also striving to be Mayor to control the appointment of other players to offices.

The game takes place over three eras (turns/decades), each with multiple phases in which players are dealt eight cards — all with historic black-and-white photos from Colorado — and must discard one and bank two for their final turn. Cards are used to either play Municipal Muscle points to build, buy, or seize structures, or used for the "event" listed on every card. Cards can also be used to set yearly "Headlines" or "Themes" which evoke a movement in American society or technology and change VP awards or other variables in the game. Structures are scored by multiplying the amount the sector tracks have advanced by the number of buildings owned. Different tracks progress differently.

Finally, players can build parks, civic buildings, hospitals, and police stations. These buildings in turn affect further play and cause neighborhoods to have more political votes at turn's end, increase VPs for proximity, or protect against certain negative cards.

Forged in Steel is an organic building game in that all builds change the landscape and players may build only adjacent to where others have built "the grid/network". At turn's end, the game decides how many immigrants come seeking jobs based on how many factories and commercial buildings were built that turn. Too many? Unrest grows and there could be a riot, undermining all of your recent city-building efforts. The National Guard will step in to help you, of course, but they are usually outnumbered, and there's often fighting in the streets, so be wary of not contributing to the "Unrest Track".

Can your family negotiate the turbulent changes of the early 1900s and become the local political and economic powerhouse? From the New Deal, Women's Suffrage, City Beautiful and Spanish Flu, to sidewalks and paved streets, all aspects of a 1900s western American city are incorporated, and players will learn about the rise of those developments that changed cities, labor, industry, and society forever.

item.description:
Modern combat in a variety of theaters. Uses same Warfighter rules system as The Guards and Movement to Contact.

Platoon-level combat uses step-loss damage system and 3 different combat tables (direct fire, assault combat, indirect fire). Scenarios written to resemble US Army operations orders. Modular geomorphic maps include both woodland and desert maps, varying urban/mountainous terrain.

Combat involves rolling dice based on unit's firepower value, subtracting target's armor, and looking up result on CRT - stun, flip, retreat, kill, no effect. All damage applied simultaneously, so 'killed' units get their final shots.

Recon units have separate objectives to acquire/locate targets of intel value.

Additional rules cover engineers (obstacles & fortifications), scouts (stealth movement & recon by fire), leaders (special battlefield effects), and compatible with civilians-on-the-battlefield rules from The Guards.

3 die-cut countersheets (56/sheet, large 7/8in counters), rules, 4 d/s maps, reference sheets for each set of units, scenarios (see below), blank scenario sheets, cardstock admin counters (non-cut), errata sheet with some counter corrections. US mechanized battalion compatible replacement for non-die-cut counters from Movement to Contact.

Units include:

 US
 Russian / Arab
 Israeli
 Arab Irregulars
 Partisan Irregulars
 Australian




5 scenarios in the box (others available online):

 US v Iraqi irregulars
 Arab v Israeli
 Russian v Chechen
 US v Balkan irregulars
 Australian v Partisan irregulars




All scenarios written as paired sheets, so each player has their own instructions that are unknown to the opponent.

item.description:
"The game consists of 21 figures... one of Charlie McCarthy and four each of Edgar Bergen, Don Ameche, Dorothy Lamour, Nelson Eddy, and Robert Armbruster. Also a spinner which determines play."

The spinner features a picture of the puppet Charlie McCarthy.

This game has a very unique theme: collecting scrap metal for the war effort.

The board features four scrap collection centers, four iron foundries, and paths among them.

This game's board has a maze of colored squares. Players are attempting to go from one part of the board to another. The theme of the game is related to Native Americans.

On the box the game is Top Pacheeza, but on the board the game is Top Pacheesa.

Hopsi the kangaroo is excited. It's about to go on holidays. The players help Hopsi to pack his bags. 
The game consists of 5 quadratic boards each showing items that Hopsi may need for its holiday such as a toothbrush or bathing suit.
Four of the boards belong to the players, the fifth is the one where Hopsi moves around.
The youngest player rolls the dice and moves Hopsi from one up to three spaces. He is allowed to mark the space (item) that he lands on on his map with a red chip.
The first player who achieves marking a row of five spaces (vertically, horizontally or diagonally) wins the game.

from the back of the box: "Have you ever wondered where the Weirdos gather? Welcome to Weird U.S., where colorful characters like the Melon Head, Skunk Ape, La Llorona, Bunnyman, Frogboy and the Killer Clown journey to not so far off places like Midgetville, Crybaby Bridge, Danvers State Hospital and the Land of 2093 Milk Jugs in their attempts to collect travelers and be the last Weirdo standing! Based on the stories from Weird U.S. by Mark Moran and Mark Sceurman. From Weird books come Weird games."

Players move around the board trying to gather travelers while dodging being exposed by Mark and Mark and battling the other Weirdos.

The game is rated Ages 8 and up.

link.value: Weird New Jersey: Weird U.S. Booster Pack

item.description: In the Celestial Empire of the Ming Dynasty the leading families vie with one another for political power and influence over the Imperial government. They do not compete by brazen force of arms, but within the confines of Confucian philosophy. Subtle influence is wielded, gifts are given and received, setting up a network of relationships that will lead one family to dominate the government under a benign Emperor. Players of Confucius participate in this discreet and delicate struggle for power. As well as influencing the three principal ministries of government, leadership of the great exploration and trading fleets will bring renown to the one who heads them, and glory attends the general leading invasions of foreign lands.

name.value: Murder à la carte: The Brie, the Bullet & the Black Cat

item.description:
You have been invited to dinner at the Official Residence of the Deputy Mayor of Casablanca. The guest of honor was to have been France's greatest ever living mime artist - but he fails to appear...you've guessed it, he's been murdered...

Everyone is a suspect, but who is the murderer?

So who stars in this great adventure, obviously you, but you don't play yourself you take on the role of one of the following characters:

Hughes Le Grandebutte - Deputy Mayor of Casablanca The epitomy of solid respectability
Edith Le Grandebutte - his wife, former dancer Married to Hughes - but not altogether happy - still yearn for your former life as a dancer
Nicole Le Grandbutte - their daughter 18 yr old daughter of above - would rather be in Paris than Casablanca - does not approve of her father working with the Germans
Otto Von Pinkelwurst - a Gestapo Officer, fanatical and possible mad Doesn't understand why he is in Africa rather than a senior staff post in Berlin
Kirk Ransom III - an American who runs Kirk's African Cafe in downtown Casablanca late 30's, doomed romantic hero nursing a broken heart and a bottle of whiskey. Suave, elegant and slightly battered.
Countess Bogov - an exiled Russian aristocrat, glamorous and mysterious. Passionate anti-communist; sympathetic with Germans
Monsieur Oily-Carte - booking agent for the Moulin Bleu nightclub in Paris Educated in England, sophisticated with impeccable manners
Pierre Payanski - 24 year old half-Russian poet. Anti-fascist with a bad leg
Cherie Boot - French cabaret singer in mid 20's Husky voice, sultry, decadent & exotic, almost androgynous
Ingrid Pith - Danish art dealer - finds painting all over Europe. Busy and flirtatious

Optional Guests for 11-12 player game :
Seamus O'Hack - a dissolute Irish journalist more interested in drinking than writing
Pia Fedora - Spanish cabaret star and love of the Black Cat. Fiery, passionate and bereaved

item.description:
Hullabaloo the Game of Observation

Players wager on winning three rounds of observation activities using pictures of cluttered junk. In Eyespy the players look for items that the Game Boss has chosen. The first player to find each of the three objects wins double his wager. In Scrutiny the players look at a picture card for a minute and then answer questions that the Game Boss asks about the picture. In Detection the Game boss picks out an item and writes several clues for the other players to use to determine that object.

Interplay is a relatively simple abstract strategy game. Play is conducted with metal pegs on a wooden board. When placing a new peg, players place a peg 3 spaces away from the previously played one - either straight, diagonally, or in an L shape.

Players score points for every peg adjacent (orthogonally or diagonally) to the peg they place. A round ends when all 37 pegs are placed (or if, due to the gameplay, no further pegs can be placed).

Einfach Genial Knobelspass (Ingenious Puzzles) is the next game in the Einfach Genial line.

In EGK, players place Ingenious dominoes to match the pattern on each play board. Through deduction and logic, players figure out where each domino belongs since no spaces can remain, all dominoes must fit on the board and there is only one unique combination for each one.

Each of the 1 to 4 players gets an identical set of 21 dominoes that have the same colored back and each player is given a board. Then you all race to solve the puzzles. Whoever solves his puzzle problem first wins.

There are five levels of puzzle, providing an opportunity for more and more challenging levels of competitive play. You can handicap more experienced or older players by having them play a higher level of board.

This is similar to Domino Knobelspass, which uses regular dominoes.

item.description:
WordFare! combines the fun of Scrabble with a good bit of strategy and random chance. Like similar word games, you don't need to be a mastermind to be good at it.

You can learn the rules in a few minutes. Here are most of the rules:

1 Draw 20 tiles at random, pick the 10 you like best and put them on your row #1 (the row facing you)
2 Roll 2 dice, select one and move a tile that many spaces in a straight line. Save the other one to use later.
3 Your opponent does the same. As your letters move together, you can form words with either player's letters.

You score based on how far away from your home row the letters are, times the length of the word. There are blank tiles and a special * tile, used to replace any letter. The * tile can only be used by the player who owns it; the blanks can be used by either player. There are a couple of other simple rules involving capture of letter tiles, but you get the idea.

The board and pieces are made of hardwood and are laser engraved. Even the box is made of hardboard and is engraved.

item.description: In 1978, most Topps baseball cards had an at-bat result on the back, like Fly Out, Double, or Ground Out. These were to be used in a two-player game. A few of the cards had the complete rules on them. Players would take turns playing three-out innings, pulling cards from the top of a deck and scoring runs (if any) until three outs were drawn, at which point the turn would pass to the other player. The game would be played to nine innings, with extra innings in the case of ties.

Command and plan your Tank Battles.

In this war situation, you are the commander of a forward tank unit and the objective is to gain control of this map sector by destroying the enemy supply base, and thus force a total retreat, or by knocking out enough enemy tanks so that they concede defeat.

Both players have 10 tanks, 2 transporters and 3 bridges at their disposal to beat the enemy.

A transporter can move bridges or tanks that were shot.

The board shows rivers, mountains and flat terrain, that result in movement and shooting ristrictions.

The Art of War is a strategy game for 2-6 players played on a board divided into black, white and forest hexes. The players must strategically move and produce units in order to conquer the capital of the opposing player(s). There are only two kinds of units: military and civilian. Civilian units are used to produce new units; military units attack and defend.

The gameplay is very simple. On a turn, players may either produce new pieces or move their existing pieces. It is a game of planning the buildup to battle and putting ones forces in an advantageous position. It is not a game of doing battle and hoping to get lucky.

The length of the game depends on the number of players

2 players: 20-30 minutes
3 players: 30-60 minutes
4 players: 60-90 minutes
6 players: 90-120 minutes

item.description: This is a cool set of overlays that allow solo play or pass back and forth type games for 2 players. Most games have solo options, but not all. It really brings new life to the Etch-A-Sketch.

Be the first player to collect all eight pieces and build Thomas to win!

Players spin the spinner, and collect the piece of Thomas indicated. You can then place the piece on the base, building up your Thomas. The first player to complete their Thomas wins.

Play can continue for a number of games. Players get one point for each piece collected and that becomes their score for the game. You can either play a fixed number of rounds, or see who reaches a set score first.

Be the first player to populate the central goal line with your pawns. How you accomplish this can differ depending on the rule variant used. Examples include:

King of the Hill: Roll the dice and move one pawn either the number of spaces shown on one die, or the total of the two dice. Keep rolling and moving until a six is showing on either die, or doubles other than ones are rolled.

King of Battle: Roll the dice. Not only are you attempting to get your men to the goal line, but you are also shooting at them in an attempt to hinder their progress. Wounded pawns are removed from the board, but can be re-introduced later.

Virtually Golfing: Each track is a hole, and are played sequentially. Roll the dice, and move your pawn the lower of the two numbers towards the goal. Roll double ones and you hole out. Any other doubles mean a swing and a miss. Par is 5 for each hole, and the lowest score after all holes are played wins.

Game includes 12 pawns (6 of each color), two dice, rules, and a game board. The rules and game board can also be downloaded and printed from the http://game.peopling.net/ website, and played using your own pawns and dice.

This is the Grand Rapids, Michigan edition of Monopoloy producted by USAopoly. Here is an article on the students from Grand Valley State University who helped develop the game.

http://www.youngmoney.com/entrepreneur/student_entrepreneurs/041020

The following is from a GVSU press release.

Grand Rapids Monopoly to raise scholarshp money

A student organization at Grand Valley State University's Seidman College of Business has created a Grand Rapids themed version of the board game Monopoly. Soon players will be able to buy companies like Alticor, Meijer and Steelcase while moving pieces shaped like local landmarks like Calder's La Grande Vitesse.

The project was spearheaded by the Collegiate Entrepreneurs' Organization (CEO) at Grand Valley. Business sponsorships and sales of the game will raise funds to establish a CEO student scholarship at Grand Valley.
The game board is patterned after the familiar Monopoly board, but it features prominent local businesses in the place of the original names. Boardwalk is Alticor, Park Place is Meijer, and Steelcase is Pacific Avenue (the three highest valued properties in the game). Other featured businesses are Behler-Young, Louis Padnos Iron and Metal Company, The Gilmore Collection, 1913 Room, Rockford Construction, Old Orchard, WZZM, Grand Valley State, Calvin College, and Aquinas College. The hotels will be shaped as the Amway Grand, and houses will represent the conservatory at the Frederick Meijer Gardens. Tokens will also be shaped as local attractions, such as the La Grande Vitesse, Leonardo Da Vinci Horse, John Ball statue, and other area landmarks.

Full text availalble here:
http://www.gvsu.edu/forms/ceo/Media/monopoly2.pdf

Another article on the project may be found here:
http://www.gvsu.edu/successstory/index.cfm?fuseaction=home.story&id=FA32E53B-E926-4249-DCBD5FC17644C204

item.description: This is a simple roll and move game from Parker Brothers. The box says that the game contains Rail Road Tickets, Pullman Tickets, and Toy Money.

Kalamazoo is for sale!
Give the gift of Kalamazoo with Kalamazoo On Board.
Kalamazoo On Board is an exciting, one-of-a-kind celebration of community based on the famous "opoly" style real estate trading game. The game is customized specifically for Kalamazoo and showcases the businesses and attractions that make Kalamazoo so special.

Kalamazoo On Board is available at any Kalamazoo County Harding’s, Felpausch or D & W for only $34.99. Quantities are limited. Proceeds benefit the YWCA of Kalamazoo. Call (269)345.5595 for more information.
YWCA of Kalamazoo
http://www.ywca.org/site/apps/s/content.asp?c=bpLJJTOvHmE&b=420727&ct=1210179

From the publisher:

Checkers with fun Cranium twists! 
Compact package makes it ideal for travel 
Fun for kids -- and adults! 
Play with traditional rules or wacky new ones 
A fun, affordable gift for family and friends 
 Are you the king of king me? Get your hands on Checkers Extreme!

Play checkers the traditional way or mix it up with wacky new twists, like a 6-sided die and special Cranium spots on the board.

What's in the box? Checkers Extreme includes 24 green and yellow checker tokens, 6 checker crowns, the game board, and a 6-sided die.

From the publisher:

The game of jacks gets fun Cranium twists! 
Compact packaging makes it ideal for travel 
Laugh-out-loud fun for kids -- and adults! 
Play with traditional rules or wacky new ones 
A fun, affordable gift for family and friends 
 Need a burst of outrageous fun? Get your hands on Grab & Go Super Jacks!

Play jacks the traditional way or mix it up with wacky new twists. Can you play with your opposite hand? Can you spin the jack like a top on the lid of the can?

What's in the box? Super Jacks includes 10 jacks and 2 bouncy Cranium balls.

From the publisher:

The game of sudoku with fun Cranium twists 
Compact packaging makes it ideal for travel 
Fun for kids -- and adults! 
Play with traditional rules or wacky new ones 
A fun, affordable gift for family and friends 
 Need a burst of outrageous fun? Get your hands on Grab & Go Super Sudoku!

Get to know sudoku by playing with fun animal stickers on a smaller grid, then graduate to traditional play on a larger, more challenging grid.

What's in the box? Super Sudoku includes 2 game booklets (with 60 sudoku animal and number challenges), fun animal clings, 2 dry-erase pens, and double-sided puzzle board.

From the publisher:

The game of Mancala with fun Cranium twists! Compact packaging makes it ideal for travel. Fun for kids -- and adults! Play with traditional rules or wacky new ones.
 Need a burst of outrageous fun? Get your hands on Grab & Go Mancala Mania! A favorite of young and old alike, mancala is an ancient game loved worldwide for its unique combination of simplicity and strategy.

Play the traditional way or mix it up with wacky new twists, like reconfiguring the board to create an entirely new game!

Contents:
6-Piece Mancala Board 
48 Tokens 
6-Sided Die

This is a spin-and-move game about the three little pigs. On the box cover, the wolf is bigger than the pigs' brick house.

"Based on the movie sensation!"

name.value: Young People's Bible Game: David and Goliath

item.description: In this game from the 1890s, one player reads a card while the other guesses the subject. If correct, they get the card.

With marbles and dice, reward money and a villain trying to hide, this game is played on a 3D plastic board. Find the villain and be careful not to fall down the mountain.

The box cover features a head shot of the villain, who is wearing a white hat and has a large mustache.

name.value: Boomtown: The Building of a City

item.description: An economic board game in which players try to make the most money and build a successful city. Players can buy land, build businesses, make money and then wreck havoc on the other players with some crime, fire, lawsuits or taxation. Features both basic and advanced rules. Will also have a stock market expansion.

1889, the Victorian Age, an age of change.

The most advanced nations are fighting for total economic control. It is the perfect breeding ground for a secret society more dangerous than the Yakuza, more mysterious than the Illuminati -- "The Circle".

2 - 6 players each control one secret agency trying to protect humanity against the Circle's ultimate goal: complete Global domination.

Each round, players hire spies to uncover the Circle's secrets, infiltrate its ranks, and capture its members. Sometimes the players must cooperate to reach their goals, but often they are competing against each other. At the end of the game if you have placed the most spies within the Circle's ranks, you will be able to destroy the secret society and win the game. But be careful: the Circle could defeat all of the players.

This box contains 121 Game Pieces in different colors, 60 Spy Cards, 1 Time Wheel, 6 Secret Agency markers, 1 Victory Point table, 1 Starting Player dial, 1 plastic rivet and 1 multilingual (German and English) rulebook.

item.description:
Robin the bumblebee is looking for honey. As he buzzes about, use your paddle to bop him away. Be the last to lose your honey discs and win!

In the spirit of Looping Louie, this action/dexterity game will keep children of all ages enthralled.

Two to four players and Ages 3 and up recommended.

This is a reworked (different theme, other incidental changes) version of Loopin' Louie.

item.description:
The first player to get their Rainbow Rider over the Rainbow & into the Pot of Gold wins the game. To do this, your Rainbow Rider must be on the fifth piece of the Rainbow of any colour & then you must roll that same colour again, thus reaching the Pot of Gold. (But don't stop playing ! Finish building the entire Rainbow by rolling the die until all of the Rainbow sections have been placed on the game board !)

Another beautifully produced game from Ravensburger !

Contents

1 x Game board

25 x Coloured Rainbow pieces

4 x Rainbow riders

1 x Coloured die

1 x Instructions leaflet

MapleStory iTCG is an interactive trading card game based on the MapleStory MMORPG. The Maple Story iTCG lets you play a character leading a party to duel with your opponent. The object of the game is reduce your opponent's HP to 0 using skills, items, and monsters.

The MapleStory iTCG plays much like its online counterpart as characters battle monsters and level up yet adds the unique element of character versus character combat. The game is available in starter sets and booster packs. Boosters contain 9 cards (including one code). Starter sets contain 34 cards (including one code), one booster pack, game rules and a CD-ROM with the MapleStory online game client.

Each pack contains at least one Online code card which can be redeemed for exclusive content in the MapleStory MMORPG.

item.description:
Operation Westindien simulates the devastating effects of the German U-boats in the Caribbean from Feb. 16 to March 16. While Operation Paukenschlag (an upcoming ATO game) began along the US East Coast at the same time (equally devastating), a handful of U-boats, Group Neuland, were ordered to deploy in the Caribbean.

Unknown to most today, in 1942, the oil refineries at Aruba, Curacao, and Trinidad were vital in refining the oil arriving from Lake Maracaibo, Venezuela. Canada heavily relied on this oil, the US and England, also needed this oil for aviation fuel. For the Germans, it was a missed opportunity to really devastate the Allied oil and fuel production, which would have long lasting impact on the war.

Game Details:

System: Double Blind to capture the true flavor of submarine warfare (can be played solitaire), point to point movement

Counters: 280 Map: One 11x17 inch depicting the Caribbean area south of Cuba

Unique rules cover: Aircraft ASW radar, U-boat surface and sub-surface strengths and speeds, U-boat fuel limitations, Torpedo and U-boat surface attacks, Lake tankers, Cargo ships, B-18, A-20 bombers, Destroyers, ASW Ships, Landing saboteurs, Port Capacity.

Unlike every submarine game made, this game forces both players to complete different objectives. For the German, it is to sink cargo and oil tankers in demanding quantities and or destroy oil refineries, depending on orders. The German must find and sink tankers with oil cargo moving to refineries. For the Allied player, they must move their oil and cargo ships across the map. Oil tankers must land at a refinery, unload the oil, refine it, reload it and then move the tanker off the map with the oil through U-boat infested water. Cargo ships with non-oil material must also cross the map. Of course, their other objective is to use their bombers and meager ASW force to sink U-boats!

Available in both DTP and Print-n-Play

Formes et couleurs (french title) is a Winnie The Pooh themed game for children 3 and up. Each player takes a board with a drawn scene and tries to fill the colored shapes on it. To do so they roll one shape-die (and one color-die if they are older) and are allowed to place a piece of the matching shape (and color with the advanced rules). If they have no more matching shape on their board, they have to pass. It helps children learn shapes and colors.

3 For Me is made of 48 tiles with a different drawing on each of them. The idea of the game is to find 3 tiles with something in common; it can be "red things", "warm things", "things with a hole", "things that fly"... There are 3 games in one: the search game (4 and up), the fish style game (6 and up) and the advanced memory game (8 and up). It's very enjoyable for the whole family.

Tchic-tchac is a game for children 4 and up made of a board with 4 x 4 pegs. To start, you randomly place the 16 cubes (4 of each of the 4 colors) on the pegs and you draw one of the several cards where a 4 x 4 pattern is drawn. Your goal is to reach this pattern with a minimum number of swaps ideally in less time than your opponent.

The object of this game is to transport your trucks and containers from the start to an unloading bay avoiding as many penalties as possible.

Some of the loads are overweight and being caught with an overweight load means going back to the start.

There are squares to avoid (breakdowns, punctures and out of fuel) as well as some safety squares (truck parks), but the game is, in essence, a a race to get your loads from the start to the finish before anybody else.

One player plays the Police and cannot win the game - his goal is to hinder the other players as much as possible. (This is probably best played by a parent or Games Master. Alternatively, the Police car can be moved by mutual agreement, which makes the game playable by 2 to 6 players.)

Cap'n Tock is a pirate-themed tock game for children. To win the game, each of the 3 ships (tokens) of a player must go around the board and end up on the treasure island. Movements are decided using the magic wheel you spin on your turn; it shows either one of the 4 colors there are on the squares on the board or the wind symbol. Colors allow you to move a ship to the next square of that color clockwise. If you land on an opponent boat, it cannot move as long as you stay there. The wind symbol allows you to launch a new boat OR move to the next wind square and play again with the same boat OR free your boat from an enemy (going to next wind square) and play again.

A Dutch family game from the early postwar days (estimated).

On a very large and beautifully illustrated game board players round the globe with their ships in order to try to acquire commodities to make the most profit.
The commodities come in large amounts (51 sets of 4), such making the numbers up to 204.
The more you collect from one set, the larger your profit.
There are special rules for handling the hazards, entering a port, encountering an opponents ship, selling your commodities etc.

Voyage is done by 6 thick cardboard ships, payment is made with an uncountable amount of thin cardboard gold coins in different values.

A French family game from the late 60ies/early 70ies.

Game consists of a large gameboard depicting a railroad track, 12 cardboard locomotives in 6 colours, a load of cardboard wagons, movement and hazard cards, 6 player mats, two dice and a load of commodity cards.

Aim of the game is to be the first to add 5 wagons to your locomotive and to fill these wagons with given commodities (passengers, postal freight, dishes etc.)

Certain rules allow to exchange in excess acquired commodities with other ones or to buy a wagon for these.

A real 2-player game gem from the early post war days.

Game consists of the game board, 20 tiny, hand painted tin locomotives in a pre-war design, a dice cup and a dice.

Every player has 3 express trains (dark and light red), 3 passenger trains(dark and light green), 3 goods trains (dark and light blue) and a special train (yellow).

Aim of the game is to send all your trains from the starting station to the end station on the opposite side of the board.
Every kind of train has a fixed movement allowance: Expresses 4 squares, passengers 3 sq. and goods 2 sq.
The die only shows how many of your trains you can move, which ones you take is for your own decision.
If you pass on your throw you can move any given train one square back.

The cracker of the game is the name-giving special train lurking in the backyard of your starting station: This can be triggered by your opponent !!!

Once he has done this (or you have done this to him) by throwing a six at any time in the game (your choice), no one stops the special train.
No matter what your throw is, the special train always moves six squares.
So everyone off into the sideways - but these are shared with your opponent, and only one train can occupy a sideway at any time.

Beware: If there is at any time the special train blocked by one of your own trains so it cannot move its 6 squares - you have lost the game...
And if you think you have managed to avoid the yellow monster - it returns a second time !

name.value: Kwest: A Game of the Sea

item.description:
Game comes like most Geographia Games with a separate board and a somewhat tiny components box.

Components are 50 sailing cards (45 with a single and 5 with a double sailing symbol), 5 location cards, 15 treasure cards, two cardboard ships on wooden stands, a wooden dice cup containing a special dice.

After setting up your starting hand (15 cards with the possibility to replace from the stockpile) you draw a location card where to dig up a pirates treasure.
Sailing is done with the symbol cards, also depicted on the different sailing routes on the board.
You have to fiddle out the best and farthest calculated moves with your hand, double symbol cards allowing double moves.
In the storm reigned region in the middle of the board you have to use the special dice, depicting the standard card symbols (spade, heart, club and diamond) and 2 anchors.

If you reach your destination island you have to land on the shores, now rolling an anchor on the dice.

If you dare, you can try to plunder another island on your way back to homeport, but beware: Winner is the one returning home first with a treasure !

What adds additional spice is the possibility to capture the opponents ship and that the movement cards are randomly chosen after you emptied your starting hand, so no more calculating your route is possible.

This is one of the scarce Pepys boardgame editions.

It came in two versions: One with separate board and small components box and one with a large box, containing board and components.

Game consists of 54 playing pawns in 4 colours (small wooden cylinders), 3 sets of 4 movement cards (depicting one to four knights plus a Zero-knight card, and a large game board depicting a fictious medieval countryside.

Aim is to capture the opponents capital, starting in your own at the opposite end of the board.

At first you have to enter all your pawns onto the board square by square and then move the existing chain of knights towards the other capital.
This is done with the randomly chosen movement cards. The number depicted is the allowance to move as many knights (pawns) from the end of your chain to the front of it.
Obstacles hinder a smooth movement, and you can capture opponents knights or even cut his knights-chain off !
For all these actions you have to show the right movement card, some actions require 4 knights.

For the time edited (around 1950) a very good strategy game with much room for decision making what to do best with the random movement card. The beautifully designed gameboard adds to the atmosphere...

In times before the Fackler-Games this must be the most expensive game edition.
It was a personal dream of the author to become true, 1000 were intended to be made.

The game consists of: 1 three-dimensional wooden board, measuring approx. 1 yard square, 62 cherries in 3 colours (1 inch diameter) 62 leaves in 3 colours, 15 bonus-cherries, 42 point-allowance-pawns and 4 coloured birds on trees as playing pawns, all made of wood too.

Name of the game means "Royal Cherry".

After setting up the game with the beautiful components mentioned above players start to move their birds in the centre field measuring 7 x 6 squares, containing the point-allowance-pawns depicting leaves and cherries in alternate appearance.
The number depicted is the maximum you can harvest from a certain tree (cherries or leaves).
After your move the bird sits in the hole left by the pawn. Next time your move has to start from there, such restricting your further moves.
Aim of the game is to go for the bonus cherries counting points at the end.
You can earn them being the LAST one harvesting a tree or by being the one with the most cherries and leaves harvested from a certain tree.
As the trees have three different sizes, there are different amounts of bonus cherries to gain.

This is not a game for children, you have to twist your brain for the best moves !

From the introduction:

"Generic Outlandishly Big Spacefleets! is the game where you control vast fleets of vessels of all shapes and sizes, from nimble little fighters to moon-sized planetsmashers. Move your ships. Fire your weapons. Launch your torpedoes. And watch your enemies explode into brilliant flashes of molten metal! Everything a budding megalomaniac... err, defender of the galaxy... could want!

G.O.B.S.! is designed to allow you to build big, custom spacefleets and fight quick, explosive battles with simple rules and little or no record keeping. Just move, shoot, and (probably) explode. What could be more fun? Best of all, you can use G.O.B.S.! with any spaceship miniatures you like, from those expensive metal jobs to cheap plastic toys to scratch-built wonders made from household items. (Yours truly is contemplating a fleet made from seashells.)

In G.O.B.S.!, a ship’s speed and combat worthiness are determined by the size and apparent purpose of the miniature(or whatever the manufacturer happens to call the thing). Players may then customize the armament to reflect their preferences.
 Big ships are slow, clumsy, and easy to hit. They also carry lots and lots of weapons and are both very dangerous and hard to destroy.

Smaller ships are fast and nimble, and very hard to hit. However, they carry few weapons and are very easy to destroy.

The movement and combat systems of G.O.B.S.! are designed to reflect these general principles."

Download G.O.B.S.! at:

Homepage: http://www.thegobspage.com

item.description: A simple, humorous wargame depicting a neighborhood defending itself against a horde of yuppies bent on moving in. Movement and combat are die-based, and involve both conventional weapons and "Bad Taste" weapons such as belches and loud shirts.

One of the most exciting, ever-changing human attributes is the MIND. The way you think—the way your family, friends, and neighbors think—why you think one way one time and another way at another. Because your mind is YOU, the game PERSON-ALYSIS was created.

PERSON-ALYSIS is a revealing psychological game for adults based on the latest psycho-scientific testing techniques. It consists primarily of specially prepared inkblots and can be played by 4 or more adults.

Contents: 
· Twenty cards with 40 specially-designed inkblots
· A specially-designed inkblot holder
· "Interpretation" sheets
· Scoring pad
· Booklet on interpretations and their meanings

name.value: Edgar Bergen and Charlie McCarthy's Flying Hat Game

item.description:
This is a children's Game base on the vintage TV Characters Edgar Bergen and is dummy Charlie McCarthy.

It is a simple dexterity game of flicking the "hats" into the game Tin.

A book of 15 games based on the adventures of Tintin, the french reporter comic character created by Hergé. The various games range from purely luck driven to more abstract games with no luck whatsoever. Each game fills one or two pages of the book and some require that the players supply additional material (dice, pawns, pen and papers).

name.value: QUEST: An intriguing game of mazes!

item.description:
Very simple premise - Be the first to get out of the maze and win the game!
The unusual component is the board itself, By twisting the handle in the center, the direction you are forced to move changes, this providing the difficulty.

This game is based around magnetism. The board consists of 80 chips, some of whom are magnetic. Players take turns trying to pick the chips up using a magnetic stick. Differently colored chips are worth a different amount of points, and the player with the most points when all chips have been picked up is the winner.

Gormiti (The Invincible Lords of Nature) is a collectible mineatures game with a very big board.

The player chooses a team of creatures with every creature having a number under their left foot, and a corresponding card with their (single) stats.

The gameboard is divided into squares, and the game consists of moving the creatures and attacking the opponents creatures.

An attack is played out with the attacker moving a monster up to the number under the foot, and then adding the remainder to the number on the creatures card; if this number is larger than the defenders number on foot plus card value, then the attacker wins, else the defender does. The loosing creature is removed from the board.

The winner is the player with the last surviving monsters.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description: A mini-game included with with the WorldWorks Games cardstock model set "Platform Commander: Red Sector". It is a diceless Mech combat game that uses the customisable Mecha and scenery included in the set. There are Basic and Advanced rules versions.

Vintage spelling game. Also includes games for arithmetic.

This game features a board with the alphabet written around the edges of a circle in the center of the board. The board is 17.5 x 17.5 inches.

Unusual version of card game “Oflameron”, in which cards are used for creating a playing field, on which blocks (markers) of players are moved. For playing, you should download images of cards, print the required number of cards and buy or make a usual small playing cube. Any number of players can participate in the game. 
 You might have participated in such games, in which you move blocks along an artful road depending on the number of points shown on a playing cube thrown. You might have participated in card games. A card version of this game “Oflameron” resembles somehow both games – You should move your blocks (markers) along a road made of playing cards, depending on the number of points shown on a small playing cube thrown. During the game, you will have to estimate income and losses after each step and plan your strategy for achieving the maximal success.
 A card game created according to the principle “print-n-play”. All materials (cards, game rules, description) are presented in an electronic form, they are to be printed and then you can start playing. It is convenient – you need not buy anything for starting this game. Any number of players may participate in the game. All is defined by the number of cards and the size of a playing field. A score is kept during the game. All materials are included in a http://card.shmeleff.com/ ZIP archive.

"Get the mail through"

This is a spin-and-move game about delivering mail in the old west. It has 4 wood counters and a spinner. The board features art about the American Old West and round colored circles for a movement track.

Arabian Game is a game played on a board using regular checkers. The board features red circles with black paths between them. The black paths form three squares with a common center (each larger than the next). 'Arabian Checkers' is written in the center.

This game from the 1920s is played with marbles on a hexagon that is five spaces wide on each side. The box cover features a picture of two girls playing the game at a table with a boy sitting on the table looking on.

A family game from the pre-war times (estimated).

Players move their pawns round the railroad track according to the throw of two dice.
The board is part of the game box basement.
The track is colour-coded, so every time you land on a given colour you have to put a passenger chip (from your starting amount) into the station of the corresponding colour. 
To add some decision making you can choose if you want to do this on your own colour or not.
Every time 10 passengers have amassed on a station, the complete board (all stations) is swept by the owner.

After a pre-game agreed number of sweeps the game ends and the winner is the player with the most passengers in hand.

A little added spice are some red lights (wooden chips), which are placed in front of a train when the player throws a 2, 3 or 12.
It can only be removed by throwing a 7, 11 or double.
As long as the red light is on, the train thus blocked cannot move nor can the owner sweep the board should his station contain 10 passengers.
